contact.subtitle: Start your journey to health today. We treat even the most complex cases.
contact.consultationSubtitle: Schedule a free consultation and find out how we can help you find the best treatment abroad.

contact.toastErrorDescription: There was a problem with your request. Please try again.

footer.tagline: Your trusted partner in organizing medical treatment abroad, even for the most complex diagnoses.

homePage.heroTitle: Your <1>Trusted</1> Coordinator for Medical Treatment Abroad
homePage.heroSubtitle: We specialize in organizing treatment for complex and rare diseases. Access renowned clinics in Germany, Turkey, Spain, and Israel with full support and transparent costs.
homePage.servicesSubtitle: Comprehensive support at every stage of your medical journey, from initial diagnosis to full recovery.
homePage.service1Desc: Connecting you with top specialists for even the most complex cases.
homePage.service2Desc: Organizing transport, accommodation, and all visa formalities.
homePage.service3Desc: Assistance with documents and medical insurance for international treatment.
homePage.service4Desc: Professional medical translations and personal interpreters.
homePage.service5Desc: Round-the-clock care and support throughout the entire treatment process.
homePage.service6Desc: Cooperation only with certified and reputable institutions specializing in advanced medicine.
homePage.countriesSubtitle: Access to the best medical facilities in Europe and the Middle East for advanced and specialized treatment.
homePage.processSubtitle: A simple and transparent process from first contact to recovery, even in the most difficult situations.
homePage.step1Desc: We'll discuss your complex medical needs and propose the best treatment solutions.
homePage.step2Desc: We'll find the ideal specialized medical facility tailored to your diagnosis and budget.
homePage.step3Desc: We handle all formalities, transportation, and accommodation.
homePage.step4Desc: We accompany you throughout the entire treatment process abroad.
homePage.step5Desc: We provide support and health monitoring after you return home.
homePage.testimonialsSubtitle: Read the stories of our patients who found hope and healing abroad.
homePage.testimonial1Text: Professional approach at every stage. Thanks to CareOverseas, I received the best and most advanced medical care in Germany for my rare heart condition.
homePage.testimonial2Text: Everything was perfectly organized for a very complex surgery. The results exceeded my wildest expectations!
homePage.testimonial3Text: 24/7 support and a personalized approach. I felt safe throughout my complex treatment and recovery.

diseasesPage.title: Disease Database (ICD-10) | CareOverseas
diseasesPage.description: Find treatment for complex and rare diseases abroad. Browse our ICD-10 database for information on advanced therapies in Germany, Turkey, and Israel.
diseasesPage.subtitle: We handle even the most challenging cases. Search for a disease to learn about advanced treatment protocols and options for therapy abroad.
diseasesPage.searchPlaceholder: Search by disease, ICD-10 code, e.g., 'oncology' or 'C50'...
diseasesPage.noResults: No diseases found matching your query.

C50.name: Malignant neoplasm of breast
C50.description: Malignant neoplasm of the breast. Treatment depends on the stage and type of cancer and may include surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, hormone therapy, and targeted therapy.

I21.name: Acute myocardial infarction
I21.description: Necrosis of the heart muscle due to a sudden stop of blood supply. Requires immediate intervention, including coronary angioplasty or thrombolytic treatment.

J45.name: Asthma
J45.description: A chronic inflammatory disease of the airways. Treatment involves controller medications (inhaled corticosteroids) and reliever medications (short-acting beta-agonists).

E11.name: Type 2 diabetes mellitus
E11.description: A metabolic disease characterized by high blood glucose levels. Treatment includes diet, exercise, oral medications, and in some cases, insulin.

M16.name: Coxarthrosis [arthrosis of hip]
M16.description: Degenerative disease of the hip joint. Treatment includes physiotherapy, painkillers, and in advanced cases, hip replacement surgery.

G40.name: Epilepsy
G40.description: A chronic neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures. Treatment involves the use of antiepileptic drugs.

C34.name: Malignant neoplasm of bronchus and lung
C34.description: One of the most common malignant neoplasms. Treatment depends on the histological type and stage, and may include surgery, radiotherapy, chemotherapy, and immunotherapy.

K25.name: Gastric ulcer
K25.description: A localized defect in the gastric mucosa. Treatment includes drugs to reduce gastric acid secretion and eradication of Helicobacter pylori.

N18.name: Chronic kidney disease
N18.description: Progressive loss of kidney function. Treatment aims to slow the progression of the disease, and in the end-stage, requires dialysis or a kidney transplant.

F32.name: Depressive episode
F32.description: A mental disorder characterized by a depressed mood, loss of interest, and anhedonia. Treatment includes psychotherapy and pharmacotherapy (antidepressants).

A00-A09.name: Intestinal infectious diseases
A00-A09.description: A group of diseases caused by pathogens that attack the gastrointestinal tract.

A15-A19.name: Tuberculosis
A15-A19.description: An infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, most commonly affecting the lungs.

A20-A28.name: Certain zoonotic bacterial diseases
A20-A28.description: Diseases transmitted from animals to humans, caused by bacteria.

A30-A49.name: Other bacterial diseases
A30-A49.description: A broad category covering various bacterial infections not classified elsewhere.

A50-A64.name: Infections with a predominantly sexual mode of transmission
A50-A64.description: Diseases whose main mode of transmission is sexual contact.

A65-A69.name: Other spirochaetal diseases
A65-A69.description: Diseases caused by bacteria of the order Spirochaetales, e.g., Lyme disease.

A70-A74.name: Other diseases caused by chlamydiae
A70-A74.description: Bacterial infections caused by Chlamydia, affecting various systems.

A75-A79.name: Rickettsioses
A75-A79.description: A group of infectious diseases caused by rickettsiae, transmitted by arthropods.

A80-A89.name: Viral infections of the central nervous system
A80-A89.description: Viral infections that attack the brain and spinal cord.

A92-A99.name: Arthropod-borne viral fevers and viral haemorrhagic fevers
A92-A99.description: Severe viral diseases, often with high mortality.

B00-B09.name: Viral infections characterized by skin and mucous membrane lesions
B00-B09.description: A group of diseases such as herpes, chickenpox, shingles.

B15-B19.name: Viral hepatitis
B15-B19.description: Inflammation of the liver caused by viruses (types A, B, C, D, E).

B20-B24.name: Human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] disease
B20-B24.description: A disease that attacks the immune system, leading to AIDS.

B25-B34.name: Other viral diseases
B25-B34.description: A broad category covering various viral infections not classified elsewhere.

B50-B64.name: Protozoal diseases
B50-B64.description: Diseases caused by parasitic protozoa, e.g., malaria.

B90-B94.name: Sequelae of infectious and parasitic diseases

B95-B98.name: Bacterial, viral and other infectious agents
B95-B98.description: Codes used to identify infectious agents in diseases classified elsewhere.

C00-C97.name: Malignant neoplasms
C00-C97.description: General category for all malignant cancers.

C00-C14.name: Malignant neoplasms of lip, oral cavity and pharynx
C00-C14.description: Neoplasms located in the head and neck area.

C15-C26.name: Malignant neoplasms of digestive organs
C15-C26.description: Neoplasms of the esophagus, stomach, intestines, liver, pancreas.

C30-C39.name: Malignant neoplasms of respiratory and intrathoracic organs
C30-C39.description: Neoplasms of the lungs, bronchi, larynx.

C40-C41.name: Malignant neoplasms of bone and articular cartilage
C40-C41.description: Rare neoplasms of bone and cartilage tissue.

C43-C44.name: Melanoma and other malignant neoplasms of skin
C43-C44.description: Skin neoplasms, including the most dangerous - melanoma.

C45-C49.name: Malignant neoplasms of mesothelial and soft tissue
C45-C49.description: Neoplasms arising from connective, muscle, and fatty tissues.

C51-C58.name: Malignant neoplasms of female genital organs
C51-C58.description: Neoplasms of the ovary, cervix, uterine body.

C60-C63.name: Malignant neoplasms of male genital organs
C60-C63.description: Neoplasms of the testis, penis, prostate.

C69-C72.name: Malignant neoplasms of eye, brain and other parts of central nervous system

C73-C75.name: Malignant neoplasms of thyroid and other endocrine glands

C76-C80.name: Malignant neoplasms of ill-defined, secondary and unspecified sites
C76-C80.description: Neoplasms with metastases or unknown primary focus.

C81-C96.name: Malignant neoplasms of lymphoid, haematopoietic and related tissue
C81-C96.description: Lymphomas, leukemias, and other neoplasms of the hematopoietic system.

C97-C97.name: Malignant neoplasms of independent (primary) multiple sites
C97-C97.description: The occurrence of several independent primary neoplasms in one patient.

D00-D09.name: In situ neoplasms
D00-D09.description: Pre-invasive neoplasms with limited growth, without infiltration.

D10-D36.name: Benign neoplasms
D10-D36.description: Benign tumors that do not metastasize.

D37-D48.name: Neoplasms of uncertain or unknown behaviour
D37-D48.description: Tumors whose malignant potential is difficult to determine.

D50-D53.name: Nutritional anaemias
D50-D53.description: Anaemias caused by a deficiency of iron, vitamin B12, or folic acid.

D55-D59.name: Haemolytic anaemias
D55-D59.description: Anaemias resulting from the premature destruction of red blood cells.

D60-D64.name: Aplastic and other anaemias
D60-D64.description: Bone marrow failure in the production of blood cells.

D65-D69.name: Coagulation defects, purpura and other haemorrhagic conditions
D65-D69.description: Diseases related to abnormal blood clotting.

D70-D77.name: Other diseases of blood and blood-forming organs

D80-D89.name: Certain disorders involving the immune mechanism
D80-D89.description: Diseases related to the abnormal functioning of the immune system.

E00-E07.name: Disorders of thyroid gland
E00-E07.description: Diseases such as hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, and goiter.

E10-E14.name: Diabetes mellitus
E10-E14.description: A group of metabolic diseases characterized by high blood glucose levels.

E15-E16.name: Other disorders of glucose regulation and pancreatic internal secretion
E15-E16.description: Hypoglycemia and other conditions related to sugar metabolism.

E20-E35.name: Disorders of other endocrine glands
E20-E35.description: Diseases of the pituitary, adrenal, parathyroid glands.

E40-E46.name: Malnutrition
E40-E46.description: Conditions caused by an insufficient intake of calories or nutrients.

E50-E64.name: Other nutritional deficiencies
E50-E64.description: Deficiencies of vitamins and trace elements.

E65-E68.name: Obesity and other hyperalimentation
E65-E68.description: Excessive body weight and related complications.

E70-E90.name: Metabolic disorders
E70-E90.description: Inborn and acquired errors of metabolism.

F00-F09.name: Organic, including symptomatic, mental disorders
F00-F09.description: Mental disorders caused by brain disease or damage.

F10-F19.name: Mental and behavioural disorders due to psychoactive substance use
F10-F19.description: Addictions and complications related to the use of drugs, alcohol.

F20-F29.name: Schizophrenia, schizotypal and delusional disorders
F20-F29.description: Severe mental disorders affecting thinking, emotions, and behavior.

F50-F59.name: Behavioural syndromes associated with physiological disturbances and physical factors
F50-F59.description: Eating disorders, sleep disorders, sexual dysfunctions.

F60-F69.name: Disorders of adult personality and behaviour

F70-F79.name: Mental retardation
F70-F79.description: Significantly below-average level of intellectual functioning.

F80-F89.name: Disorders of psychological development
F80-F89.description: Disorders of speech, academic skills, autism.

F90-F98.name: Behavioural and emotional disorders with onset usually occurring in childhood and adolescence

F99-F99.name: Unspecified mental disorder
F99-F99.description: Disorders that cannot be classified elsewhere.

G00-G09.name: Inflammatory diseases of the central nervous system

G10-G14.name: Systemic atrophies primarily affecting the central nervous system

G30-G32.name: Other degenerative diseases of the nervous system

G35-G37.name: Demyelinating diseases of the central nervous system

G50-G59.name: Nerve, nerve root and plexus disorders

G60-G64.name: Polyneuropathies and other disorders of the peripheral nervous system

G70-G73.name: Diseases of myoneural junction and muscle

G80-G83.name: Cerebral palsy and other paralytic syndromes

G90-G99.name: Other disorders of the nervous system

H00-H06.name: Disorders of eyelid, lacrimal system and orbit

H15-H22.name: Disorders of sclera, cornea, iris and ciliary body

H40-H42.name: Glaucoma
H40-H42.description: A disease leading to damage of the optic nerve.

H43-H45.name: Disorders of vitreous body and globe

H46-H48.name: Disorders of optic nerve and visual pathways

H49-H52.name: Disorders of ocular muscles, binocular movement, accommodation and refraction

H55-H59.name: Other disorders of eye and adnexa
H55-H59.description: Nystagmus and other irregular eye movements.

H65-H75.name: Diseases of middle ear and mastoid

I00-I02.name: Acute rheumatic fever
I00-I02.description: A complication of streptococcal infection, affecting the heart, joints, brain.

I05-I09.name: Chronic rheumatic heart diseases
I05-I09.description: Valvular heart diseases as a sequel to rheumatic fever.

I20-I25.name: Ischaemic heart diseases
I20-I25.description: Coronary artery disease, angina pectoris, myocardial infarction.

I26-I28.name: Pulmonary heart disease and diseases of pulmonary circulation

I70-I79.name: Diseases of arteries, arterioles and capillaries

I80-I89.name: Diseases of veins, lymphatic vessels and lymph nodes, not elsewhere classified

I95-I99.name: Other and unspecified disorders of the circulatory system

J00-J06.name: Acute upper respiratory infections
J00-J06.description: Common cold, acute sinusitis, pharyngitis, laryngitis.

J09-J18.name: Influenza and pneumonia
J09-J18.description: Viral and bacterial infections of the respiratory system.

J30-J39.name: Other diseases of upper respiratory tract

J40-J47.name: Chronic lower respiratory diseases
J40-J47.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, bronchiectasis.

J60-J70.name: Lung diseases due to external agents

J80-J84.name: Other respiratory diseases principally affecting the interstitium

J85-J86.name: Suppurative and necrotic conditions of lower respiratory tract

J95-J99.name: Other diseases of the respiratory system

K00-K14.name: Diseases of oral cavity, salivary glands and jaws
K00-K14.description: Dental caries, gingivitis, diseases of the tongue.

K20-K31.name: Diseases of oesophagus, stomach and duodenum
K20-K31.description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease, gastritis, peptic ulcer disease.

K55-K64.name: Other diseases of intestines
K55-K64.description: Irritable bowel syndrome, vascular disorders of intestine, hemorrhoids.

K80-K87.name: Disorders of gallbladder, biliary tract and pancreas

K90-K93.name: Other diseases of the digestive system

L00-L08.name: Infections of the skin and subcutaneous tissue

L50-L54.name: Urticaria and erythema
L50-L54.description: Various types of urticaria and erythema.

L55-L59.name: Radiation-related disorders of the skin and subcutaneous tissue

L80-L99.name: Other disorders of the skin and subcutaneous tissue

cardiacPage.title: Advanced Cardiac Surgery in Germany | Complex Heart Conditions
cardiacPage.description: World-class cardiac surgery for complex conditions in Germany. Treatment of rare heart diseases, minimally invasive surgery, and access to top surgeons.
cardiacPage.subtitle: Access Germany's leading heart centers, renowned for treating the most complex cardiac cases with pioneering surgical techniques and state-of-the-art technology.
cardiacPage.whyGermanyTitle: Why Germany for Complex Cardiac Surgery?
cardiacPage.whyGermanySubtitle: Germany is a global leader in medical innovation, especially in complex cardiovascular treatments. We handle cases others can't.
cardiacPage.feature1Desc: Clinics equipped with robotic surgery for complex and minimally invasive procedures.
cardiacPage.feature2Desc: Access to world-renowned surgeons specializing in rare and complex heart diseases.
cardiacPage.feature3Desc: Access to the newest, most effective treatment methods for complex conditions.
cardiacPage.feature4Desc: Excellent outcomes even in high-risk cases and superior post-operative care.
cardiacPage.proceduresSubtitle: We facilitate a wide range of advanced cardiac procedures, from minimally invasive interventions to complex open-heart and revision surgeries.
cardiacPage.procedure2: Advanced Heart Valve Repair and Replacement
cardiacPage.procedure5: Minimally Invasive and Robotic Cardiac Surgery
cardiacPage.ctaTitle: Ready to Take the Next Step for Your Heart?
cardiacPage.ctaSubtitle: Our dedicated team is here to guide you through every step. Contact us for a free, no-obligation consultation for your specific case.

epilepsySpainPage.title: Advanced Epilepsy Treatment in Spain | VNS Therapy & Medication
epilepsySpainPage.description: Discover effective medication treatment for epilepsy in Spain from $4000. Access JCI-accredited clinics, VNS Therapy, and leading neurology specialists.
epilepsySpainPage.header: Medication Treatment for Epilepsy in Spain
epilepsySpainPage.subtitle: Access advanced solutions for epilepsy in trusted Spanish clinics, with personalized medication plans starting from $4000.
epilepsySpainPage.whySpainTitle: Why Choose Spain for Epilepsy Treatment?
epilepsySpainPage.whySpainSubtitle: Spain combines internationally recognized quality standards with innovative therapeutic approaches, providing hope and results for patients with epilepsy.
epilepsySpainPage.feature1Desc: JCI-certified hospitals in Spain provide high-quality care and comply with international healthcare standards.
epilepsySpainPage.feature2Desc: Spain employs techniques like VNS Therapy (Vagus Nerve Stimulation) and uses modern medications such as Briviact and Fycompa.
epilepsySpainPage.feature3Desc: Medication treatment shows a 70-80% efficacy rate in reducing seizure frequency among patients in Spain.
epilepsySpainPage.feature4Desc: Renowned specialists excel in individualized drug selection for epilepsy, ensuring the most effective treatment plan for each patient.
epilepsySpainPage.ctaTitle: Take Control of Your Health Journey
epilepsySpainPage.ctaSubtitle: Contact us today for a free consultation and let our specialists create a personalized epilepsy treatment plan for you in Spain.

brainCancerPage.title: Advanced Neurosurgery | Glioblastoma, Malformations
brainCancerPage.description: Get a second opinion from top neurosurgeons from $800. We specialize in treating glioblastoma, brain malformations, and other complex tumors.
brainCancerPage.subtitle: Access to world-class neurosurgeons and innovative therapies for glioblastoma, malformations, and other brain tumors. Second opinion from $800.
brainCancerPage.whyUsSubtitle: We provide access to leading specialists and cutting-edge technologies for the most complex neurological cases.
brainCancerPage.feature1Desc: Consultations and treatment from world-renowned experts in neuro-oncology.
brainCancerPage.feature2Desc: Specializing in hard-to-treat tumors like glioblastoma and vascular malformations.
brainCancerPage.feature3Desc: Access to Gamma Knife, proton therapy, and the latest targeted drug therapies.
brainCancerPage.feature4Desc: Get a comprehensive second opinion and treatment plan from a leading expert, starting at just $800.
brainCancerPage.ctaTitle: Get Expert Insight on Your Case
brainCancerPage.ctaSubtitle: Don't face a difficult diagnosis alone. Get a second opinion from a world-class neurosurgeon to explore all your treatment options.

bloodDiseasesPage.title: Advanced Treatment for Blood Diseases & Blood Cancer
bloodDiseasesPage.description: Specialized treatment for leukemia, lymphoma, myeloma, and other complex blood disorders. Access to bone marrow transplants and innovative therapies.
bloodDiseasesPage.subtitle: Comprehensive care for blood cancers and hematological disorders, from diagnosis to innovative therapies and bone marrow transplantation.
bloodDiseasesPage.whyUsSubtitle: We connect you with leading hematology-oncology centers specializing in complex and rare blood disorders.
bloodDiseasesPage.feature1Desc: Access to top hematologists and oncologists with experience in treating rare blood cancers.
bloodDiseasesPage.feature2Desc: Precise diagnosis using genetic testing, flow cytometry, and advanced imaging.
bloodDiseasesPage.feature3Desc: Access to CAR-T cell therapy, targeted therapies, and bone marrow transplants.
bloodDiseasesPage.feature4Desc: A multidisciplinary approach to treating the full spectrum of blood diseases.
bloodDiseasesPage.ctaTitle: Find the Best Path for Your Treatment
bloodDiseasesPage.ctaSubtitle: Contact us for a personalized consultation and learn about the advanced treatment options available for your condition.

rheumatologyIsraelPage.title: Rheumatology in Israel | Treatment for Arthritis, Lupus, Vasculitis
rheumatologyIsraelPage.description: Access world-class rheumatologists in Israel. First consultation from $750. Personalized treatment plans for rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and other autoimmune diseases.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.subtitle: Personalized treatment from the world's best professors for arthritis, lupus, and other complex autoimmune diseases. First consultation from $750.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.whyIsraelSubtitle: Israel is at the forefront of immunology and rheumatology, offering innovative biological therapies and personalized treatment strategies.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.feature1Desc: Direct access to leading Israeli rheumatologists and immunologists for diagnosis and treatment.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.feature2Desc: Access to the latest generation of biological drugs and targeted therapies for autoimmune diseases.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.feature3Desc: Treatment plans tailored to your specific genetic and immunological profile for maximum effectiveness.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.feature4Desc: Advanced diagnostic capabilities to accurately identify complex and overlapping rheumatic conditions.
rheumatologyIsraelPage.ctaTitle: Get a World-Class Opinion on Your Condition
rheumatologyIsraelPage.ctaSubtitle: Schedule your initial consultation with a top Israeli rheumatologist and get a personalized treatment plan from one of the world's best professors.

dendriticCellPage.title: Dendritic Cell Therapy in Germany | CareOverseas
dendriticCellPage.description: Pioneering dendritic cell immunotherapy in Germany for cancer treatment. Personalized vaccines to activate your immune system against tumors. Starting from €7000.
dendriticCellPage.subtitle: Harness the power of your own immune system. Access personalized dendritic cell vaccines—a groundbreaking approach to cancer treatment.
dendriticCellPage.whyGermanyTitle: Why Dendritic Cell Therapy in Germany?
dendriticCellPage.whyGermanySubtitle: German clinics are at the forefront of immunotherapy research and application, offering highly personalized and precise treatments.
dendriticCellPage.feature1Desc: Therapy is created from your own immune cells for maximum effectiveness and minimal side effects.
dendriticCellPage.feature2Desc: Dendritic cells are trained to recognize and attack cancer cells specifically, sparing healthy tissue.
dendriticCellPage.feature3Desc: Vaccines are produced in certified, state-of-the-art labs adhering to the strictest quality standards.
dendriticCellPage.feature4Desc: Immunotherapy is often integrated with other treatments for a comprehensive approach.
dendriticCellPage.pricingSubtitle: Clear and upfront cost structure for your treatment plan.
dendriticCellPage.dcVaccineDesc: The core of the treatment, this personalized vaccine is created to activate your immune response. Multiple doses are typically required.
dendriticCellPage.lpDesc: A necessary initial step to collect the immune cells (monocytes) from your blood, which are then used to create all subsequent vaccines.
dendriticCellPage.ctaTitle: Is Dendritic Cell Therapy Right for You?
dendriticCellPage.ctaSubtitle: This therapy is suitable for various solid tumors. Contact us for a free, confidential medical evaluation to determine your eligibility.

ivfTurkeyPage.title: IVF Treatment in Turkey | CareOverseas
ivfTurkeyPage.description: Affordable, high-quality IVF treatment in Turkey. Access world-class fertility clinics with high success rates. IVF packages start from $3000.
ivfTurkeyPage.subtitle: Realize your dream of parenthood with Turkey's leading fertility centers, combining advanced technology with compassionate care at an affordable cost.
ivfTurkeyPage.whyTurkeySubtitle: Turkey has become a top destination for fertility treatment due to its unique combination of quality, cost, and care.
ivfTurkeyPage.feature1Desc: Clinics boast success rates comparable to or exceeding global averages, using the latest techniques.
ivfTurkeyPage.feature2Desc: Receive top-tier medical care at a fraction of the cost in Europe or the US.
ivfTurkeyPage.feature3Desc: Access to modern embryology labs with technologies like PGT, IMSI, and time-lapse incubators.
ivfTurkeyPage.feature4Desc: Highly skilled fertility experts and embryologists dedicated to personalized patient care.
ivfTurkeyPage.pricingSubtitle: Transparent and accessible pricing for your peace of mind.
ivfTurkeyPage.ivfPackageDesc: Includes all standard procedures: consultations, egg retrieval, fertilization (ICSI), and embryo transfer.
ivfTurkeyPage.microTeseDesc: A surgical sperm retrieval technique for cases of non-obstructive azoospermia, performed by expert urologists.
ivfTurkeyPage.note: Note: Final costs may vary based on individual medical needs and required medications. We provide a detailed cost estimate after your initial consultation.
ivfTurkeyPage.ctaSubtitle: Let our experienced team guide you. We offer a free, confidential consultation to discuss your options and answer all your questions.

endometriosisPage.title: Endometriosis & Leomyoma Treatment | CareOverseas
endometriosisPage.description: Advanced, personalized treatment for endometriosis and leomyoma. Access leading gynecological specialists and minimally invasive surgical options.
endometriosisPage.subtitle: Find relief and expert care with our partner clinics specializing in cutting-edge, minimally invasive treatments for complex gynecological conditions.
endometriosisPage.whyUsSubtitle: We connect you with centers of excellence that prioritize your well-being and long-term health.
endometriosisPage.feature1Desc: Access to gynecologists renowned for their expertise in complex endometriosis and leomyoma cases.
endometriosisPage.feature2Desc: Utilizing the latest imaging and diagnostic techniques for accurate staging and planning.
endometriosisPage.feature3Desc: Emphasis on laparoscopic and robotic surgery for faster recovery and less scarring.
endometriosisPage.feature4Desc: Comprehensive care plans that include pain management, hormonal therapy, and fertility preservation.
endometriosisPage.treatmentsSubtitle: Our partner clinics offer a full spectrum of modern treatments tailored to your specific condition and goals.
endometriosisPage.modality1: Laparoscopic Excision: Gold-standard for removing endometriosis lesions.
endometriosisPage.modality3: Hormonal Therapies: Managing symptoms and preventing recurrence.
endometriosisPage.modality4: Fertility-Sparing Procedures: Options for patients who wish to conceive.
endometriosisPage.modality5: Comprehensive Pain Management: Multidisciplinary approach to improve quality of life.
endometriosisPage.ctaTitle: Your Health and Comfort are Our Priority
endometriosisPage.ctaSubtitle: Don't let pain control your life. Let us help you find the right specialist and treatment plan. Reach out today to begin your journey to recovery.

jointReplacementPage.title: Joint Replacement Surgery | CareOverseas
jointReplacementPage.description: Regain mobility with advanced joint replacement surgery (hip, knee, shoulder). Access top orthopedic surgeons and state-of-the-art prosthetic technology.
jointReplacementPage.subtitle: Restore your mobility and live pain-free with leading orthopedic centers specializing in hip, knee, and shoulder replacement.
jointReplacementPage.whyUsSubtitle: Our partner clinics are at the forefront of orthopedic surgery, ensuring durable results and a quick return to an active lifestyle.
jointReplacementPage.feature1Desc: Access to the latest, highest-quality implants for longevity and natural movement.
jointReplacementPage.feature2Desc: Consult with surgeons who are pioneers in joint replacement and revision surgery.
jointReplacementPage.feature3Desc: Benefit from computer-navigated and robotic systems for perfect implant placement.
jointReplacementPage.feature4Desc: Modern rehabilitation programs designed to get you back on your feet faster.
jointReplacementPage.typesSubtitle: We offer comprehensive solutions for all major joints, tailored to your anatomy and lifestyle.
jointReplacementPage.procedure1: Total Hip Replacement (THR): Using anterior, lateral, or posterior approaches.
jointReplacementPage.procedure3: Partial Knee Replacement: A less invasive option for localized arthritis.
jointReplacementPage.procedure4: Shoulder Replacement: Both anatomic and reverse shoulder arthroplasty.
jointReplacementPage.procedure5: Complex Revision Surgery: Expert solutions for failed or painful joint replacements.
jointReplacementPage.ctaTitle: Take the First Step Towards a Pain-Free Life
jointReplacementPage.ctaSubtitle: Contact us today for a free evaluation of your case. We will connect you with a top orthopedic specialist to discuss your best treatment options.

plasticSurgeryPage.title: Plastic Surgery in Turkey | Rhinoplasty, Facelift, Breast Augmentation
plasticSurgeryPage.description: Affordable, high-quality plastic surgery in Turkey. Access top surgeons for procedures like rhinoplasty, liposuction, and hair transplants at competitive prices.
plasticSurgeryPage.header: Excellence in Plastic Surgery in Turkey
plasticSurgeryPage.subtitle: Achieve your aesthetic goals with world-renowned Turkish surgeons, combining artistry with advanced medical technology.
plasticSurgeryPage.ctaSubtitle: Contact us for a confidential, no-obligation consultation and receive a personalized quote from a leading Turkish clinic.
